intro: Ecballium elaterium subsp. dioicum, commonly known as the common cocklebur, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny, spherical fruits that contain seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, with opposite, heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers arranged in composite heads. Its fruits are adapted for explosive dispersal, a mechanism known as ballistic seed dispersal. This species is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain regions.
